title: Son of a Gunfighter
text:
Son of a Gunfighter (<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a>: "El Hijo del Pistolero") is a 1965 <a href="Western%20%28genre%29">Western</a> film directed by <a href="Paul%20Landres">Paul Landres</a>. It was the last <a href="Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer">MGM</a> film to be shot in <a href="CinemaScope">CinemaScope</a>.
<a href="Russ%20Tamblyn">Russ Tamblyn</a> was cast as "Son of a Gunfighter" in <a href="Quentin%20Tarantino">Quentin Tarantino</a>'s "<a href="Django%20Unchained">Django Unchained</a>" as a homage to this film.
Plot.
Along the Mexican–American border, outlaws rob a <a href="bank">bank</a> then attack a <a href="stagecoach">stagecoach</a> and find themselves defeated with the help of an ace <a href="gunfighter">gunman</a> who seems to be looking for the group leader. After being injured in a shoot-out with <a href="bandidos">bandidos</a>, the young man continues his quest, aided by the Mexican rancher the bandits were trying to rob.
